org.azeckoski.reflectutils
Class ConstructorUtils

java.lang.Object
  org.azeckoski.reflectutils.ConstructorUtils

public class ConstructorUtils
extends Object

Class which provides methods for dealing with class constructors, also provides access to all the public constructors for a class

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (azeckoski @ gmail.com)

Field Summary
protected static SoftReference<ConstructorUtils> instanceStorage

ConstructorUtils()
          Empty constructor
WARNING: use the getInstance() method to get this rather than recreating it over and over
 
Method Summary
static boolean classAssignable(Class<?> assignFrom, Class<?> assignTo)
          Checks if assignFrom is assignable to assignTo (i.e. this is OK: assignFrom b; assignTo a = (assignTo) b;)
An example of this is: Integer b; Object a = (Object) b;
Another example of this is: ExtendedThing b; Thing a = (Thing) b;
This works like classEquals(Class, Class) and will convert primitive class types for comparison automatically
static boolean classEquals(Class<?> c1, Class<?> c2)
          Will compare 2 classes for equality which will make a friendly comparison of types and will happily compare primitive types with wrappers and say they are equal
<T> T
constructClass(Class<T> type)
          Construct an object for the class of the given type regardless of whether it has a default constructor, this will construct anything which has a valid class type including primitives, arrays, collections and even classes without default constructors, this will attempt to use the default constructor first if available though, It must be possible to construct the class without knowing something about it beforehand, (i.e. classes with only constructors which require non-null arguments will not be able to be constructed)
<T> T
constructClass(Class<T> type, Object[] params)
          Construct an object for the class of the given type with the given params (arguments), arguments must match or the construction will fail

getInterfacesForClass

public static List<Class<?>> getInterfacesForClass(Class<?> type)
A simple but efficient method for getting the interfaces for a class type, this has some shortcuts for the common types like maps, lists, etc.
Only returns the interfaces for the current type and not for all nested types

Parameters:
type - any class type
Returns:
the list of interfaces (empty if none)

getExtendAndInterfacesForClass

public static List<Class<?>> getExtendAndInterfacesForClass(Class<?> type)
Adds the class which this class extends (if there is one) to the list of interfaces

Parameters:
type - any class type
Returns:
the list of interfaces and the class this extends (empty if none)
See Also:

classEquals

public static boolean classEquals(Class<?> c1,
                                  Class<?> c2)
Will compare 2 classes for equality which will make a friendly comparison of types and will happily compare primitive types with wrappers and say they are equal

Parameters:
c1 - any class
c2 - any class
Returns:
true if the classes are equivalent, false otherwise

classAssignable

public static boolean classAssignable(Class<?> assignFrom,
                                      Class<?> assignTo)
Checks if assignFrom is assignable to assignTo (i.e. this is OK: assignFrom b; assignTo a = (assignTo) b;)
An example of this is: Integer b; Object a = (Object) b;
Another example of this is: ExtendedThing b; Thing a = (Thing) b;
This works like classEquals(Class, Class) and will convert primitive class types for comparison automatically

Parameters:
assignFrom - any class
assignTo - any class
Returns:
true if the class is assignable or equal OR false otherwise

constructClass

public <T> T constructClass(Class<T> type)
Construct an object for the class of the given type regardless of whether it has a default constructor, this will construct anything which has a valid class type including primitives, arrays, collections and even classes without default constructors, this will attempt to use the default constructor first if available though, It must be possible to construct the class without knowing something about it beforehand, (i.e. classes with only constructors which require non-null arguments will not be able to be constructed)

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
type - any object class
Returns:
the newly constructed object of the given class type (if primitive then a wrapped object will be returned which java will unwrap automatically)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the class is null or the class cannot be constructed

constructClass

public <T> T constructClass(Class<T> type,
                            Object[] params)
Construct an object for the class of the given type with the given params (arguments), arguments must match or the construction will fail

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
type - any object class
params - the parameters (args) for the constructor
Returns:
the newly constructed object of the given class type OR fails if the params cannot be matched
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the class is null or the class cannot be constructed

toString in class Object

Get a singleton instance of this class to work with (stored statically)
WARNING: do not hold onto this object or cache it yourself, call this method again if you need it again

Returns:
a singleton instance of this class

Set the singleton instance of the class which will be stored statically
